attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Zimbabwe National Water Authority (ZINWA) is undertaking the development of the Dande Dam situated in Guruve, Zimbabwe. With a substantial capacity of 160 million cubic meters, the dam aims to support extensive agricultural irrigation, covering a minimum of 4,000 hectares of land. Additionally, it will generate 3.6 MW of energy, contributing to the region's power needs. Moreover, the dam's irrigation capabilities extend even further, reaching up to 4,500 hectares of land, promising significant agricultural benefits for the area.

attributes.title: Batoka Gorge Hydro Electricity Scheme, Zimbabwe

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Batoka Gorge Hydro Electricity Scheme, Zimbabwe | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Zambezi River Authority is developing the Batoka Gorge Hydro Electricity Scheme (BHES) a 2.4GW hydroelectric project located across the boundary between Zambia and Zimbabwe on the Zambezi River approximately 54km downstream of the Victoria Waterfall .The project scope encompasses a run-of-the-river hydroelectric facility comprising a 181m-high and 720m-long roller compacted concrete (RCC) gravity arch dam and two 1200MW surface power plants on the north and south banks of the Zambezi River.

body.value: Zambezi River Authority is developing the Batoka Gorge Hydro Electricity Scheme (BHES) a 2.4GW hydroelectric project located across the boundary between Zambia and Zimbabwe on the Zambezi River approximately 54km downstream of the Victoria Waterfall .The project scope encompasses a run-of-the-river hydroelectric facility comprising a 181m-high and 720m-long roller compacted concrete (RCC) gravity arch dam and two 1200MW surface power plants on the north and south banks of the Zambezi River. Each power plant will be equipped with six 200MW hydro turbines.The reservoir will have a catchment area of 508000kmÂ² and four intakes which will take the water through 4.2km of tunnels to both the power plants to generate electricity.The project aims to have a crest overflow type spillway with 12 radial gates. Each radial gate will measure 13m-high and 14m-wide. The design capacity of the spillway will be 20000mÂ³/s.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Botswana Housing Corporation (BHC) is undertaking the construction of the UNZOVU Estate (Kazungula Housing Project) in Botswana. This project, located in the tourism and trade gateway village of Kazungula, includes a total of 212 housing units. The development has been divided into four packages: Package 1: Consists of 60 housing units, comprising 26 low-income houses, 33 medium-income houses, and 1 high-income house. Package 2: Includes 51 units, all designated as low-income houses. Package 3: Involves 36 units of two to three-bedroom flats.

body.value:
The Botswana Housing Corporation (BHC) is undertaking the construction of the UNZOVU Estate (Kazungula Housing Project) in Botswana. This project, located in the tourism and trade gateway village of Kazungula, includes a total of 212 housing units. The development has been divided into four packages:

Package 1: Consists of 60 housing units, comprising 26 low-income houses, 33 medium-income houses, and 1 high-income house.

Package 2: Includes 51 units, all designated as low-income houses.

Package 3: Involves 36 units of two to three-bedroom flats.

Package 4: Comprises 65 housing units.

These packages reflect the diversified approach of the project, catering to different income brackets and housing needs within the Kazungula area. As part of the infrastructure for the development, the Corporation will also undertake construction of internal roads, storm water drainage and water reticulation.

body.value:
Sasol plans to develop the Boegoebaai Green Hydrogen Programme within the Namakwa Special Economic Zone (SEZ) in the Northern Cape, South Africa. This large-scale initiative aims to establish a global hub for green hydrogen and its derivatives. Designated as a Strategic Integrated Project (SIP) under the South African National Development Plan, Boegoebaai already hosts an established hydrogen production plant. The expanded development is expected to include an additional 60,000 hectares adjacent to the existing plant.

Sasolâs plans include:

  • Constructing 10 GW of electrolyser capacity at the Boegoebaai SEZ.
  • Developing 240,000 hectares for renewable energy generation infrastructure.
  • Partnering with the private sector to build a green hydrogen pipeline system connecting projects across the province to the SEZ.
  • Collaborating with State-owned freight and logistics group Transnet to deploy dedicated rail infrastructure, linking green hydrogen producers to the SEZ and other ports in the country by 2030.

This comprehensive plan is set to significantly enhance South Africa's green hydrogen production capabilities, positioning the country as a leader in the global green hydrogen economy.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Doornhoek PV Project, South Africa | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: AMEA Power has been awarded a 120 MW solar photovoltaic (PV) project near Klerksdorp in South Africa's North West Province as part of the Sixth Bid Submission Phase of the Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement (REIPPP) ProgrammeThe Doornhoek PV Project will sell electricity to the state utility, Eskom, under a 20-year Power Purchase AgreementIt is expected to power 97,000 households annually and have a future life of 30 yearsThe project owners are AMEA Power: 51%; Local Community Trust: 2.5%; and a consortium wholly owned by African women, f

body.value:
• AMEA Power has been awarded a 120 MW solar photovoltaic (PV) project near Klerksdorp in South Africa's North West Province as part of the Sixth Bid Submission Phase of the Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement (REIPPP) Programme
  • The Doornhoek PV Project will sell electricity to the state utility, Eskom, under a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement
  • It is expected to power 97,000 households annually and have a future life of 30 years
  • The project owners are AMEA Power: 51%; Local Community Trust: 2.5%; and a consortium wholly owned by African women, formed by Ziyanda Energy and Dzimuzwo Consulting: 46.5% (WindWorks Holdings (Pty): 64.52%; and K2022301132 (South Africa) (Pty) Ltd: 35.48%

 

Transmission Network Connection:

The Facility will connect to the existing Eskom network at the Klerksdorp North 132/11kV Substation and the Brakspruit 132/22kV Substation line by establishing a 132kV Switching Station on the Property. The Project Company has applied for grid connection under the Eskom selfbuild Programme, as such the Project Company will construct the grid connection works and transfer the assets over to Eskom at COD

The Self-build Works are:
â¢ Establish 132kV switching station with two 132kV feeder bays for one incomer and one outgoing
â¢ Cut in the 132kV line and create a Loop-In Loop-Out (LILO) between the Brakspruit and Klerksdorp North substations
â¢ Build 100m of 132kV Kingbird overhead line from the existing 132kV line to LILO on the 132kV Switching Station
â¢ Install metering at the 132kV Switching Station
â¢ Shift the normal open point from Klerksdorp North 132/11kV substation to the new 132kV Switching Station

Planned voltage connection level: 132 kV
Planned connection point: new 132kV Doornhoek PV Switching Station, between Klerksdorp north 132/11kV and Brakspruit 132/22kV substation line

attributes.title: Angola Rural Solar Energy Project MCA

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Angola Rural Solar Energy Project MCA | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The project is part of Angola Solar Mini-Grids & Water Infrastructure Project, also known as Angola's Rural Solar Energy and Water Supply Project.

body.value:
The project is part of Angola Solar Mini-Grids & Water Infrastructure Project, also known as Angola's Rural Solar Energy and Water Supply Project.

Angolaâs Ministry of Energy and Water has proposed the construction of 48 hybrid PV systems across multiple provinces including Moxico, Lunda Norte, Lunda Sul, Bie, and Malanje. These mini-grid systems are set to have a combined capacity of 296 MW of solar energy supported by energy storage in lithium-ion batteries totaling 719 MWh.

Furthermore, approximately 200,000 households across 60 communities throughout the country are expected to benefit from this initiative. This project represents a significant step towards expanding access to reliable and sustainable energy sources thereby improving the livelihoods and socio-economic development of communities across Angola.

The project is part of Angola Solar Mini-Grids & Water Infrastructure Project, also known as Angola's Rural Solar Energy and Water Supply Project.

Angolaâs Ministry of Energy and Water has proposed the construction of 48 hybrid PV systems across multiple provinces including Moxico, Lunda Norte, Lunda Sul, Bie, and Malanje. These mini-grid systems are set to have a combined capacity of 296 MW of solar energy supported by energy storage in lithium-ion batteries totaling 719 MWh.

Furthermore, approximately 200,000 households across 60 communities throughout the country are expected to benefit from this initiative. This project represents a significant step towards expanding access to reliable and sustainable energy sources thereby improving the livelihoods and socio-economic development of communities across Angola.

attributes.content: Abuja Mass Transit Railway, Nigeria | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Abuja rail mass transit project is being developed by the Federal Capital Development Authority (FCDA). The rail line is planned to cover a total distance of 290 km and be developed in six phases or lots. The 42.5 km Lot 1 which has been completed has two lines and 12 stations connecting the Abuja City Centre with the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport. Lot 2 connects from Gwagwa through the metro station to Nyanya/Karu. The Blue Line (Lot 3) is expected to pass through Idu to Kubwa with stations in Idu Gwagwa Deidei Kagini and Gbazango.

attributes.title: Giyani Bulk Water Pipeline, South Africa

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Giyani Bulk Water Pipeline, South Africa | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Department of Water and Sanitation (DWS) plans to develop Bulk Water Project to ensure water delivery to 55 villages in Giyani. The project is being developed in various phases: 1. Nandoni Water Service Scheme: The dam will be upgraded from 60 Ml/d to 120 Ml/d to feed the bulk water pipeline projects to extend the supply from Nandoni water treatment works to Malamulele Vuwani Elim Makhado and the Sinthumule Kutama areas.

body.value:
The Department of Water and Sanitation (DWS) plans to develop Bulk Water Project to ensure water delivery to 55 villages in Giyani. The project is being developed in various phases:

1. Nandoni Water Service Scheme: The dam will be upgraded from 60 Ml/d to 120 Ml/d to feed the bulk water pipeline projects to extend the supply from Nandoni water treatment works to Malamulele Vuwani Elim Makhado and the Sinthumule Kutama areas.
2. Nandoni to Nsami: This involves expanding the existing raw water pump station Nandoni to cater for the Nsami/Giyani pipeline (40 km) and utilising the existing new infrastructure to support the Mavambe bulk main pipe which includes modifying the existing Mavambe pump station at Nandoni
3. Giyani Water Treatment Works: Phase 1 of the project entails refurbishment of the existing 30 Ml/d. Phase 2 of the project involes upgrade of the water treatment work from 30 MI/d to 40 MI/d.
4. Giyani Water Service Project: Revitalisation of 154 boreholes and the installation of package plants.
5. Reticulation to 55 villages in Giyani

2. Nandoni to Nsami: This involves expanding the existing raw water pump station Nandoni to cater for the Nsami/Giyani pipeline (40 km) and utilising the existing new infrastructure to support the Mavambe bulk main pipe which includes modifying the existing Mavambe pump station at Nandoni
3. Giyani Water Treatment Works: Phase 1 of the project entails refurbishment of the existing 30 Ml/d. Phase 2 of the project involes upgrade of the water treatment work from 30 MI/d to 40 MI/d.
4. Giyani Water Service Project: Revitalisation of 154 boreholes and the installation of package plants.
5. Reticulation to 55 villages in Giyani

attributes.title: N3 Route Construction and Upgrades, South Africa

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: N3 Route Construction and Upgrades, South Africa | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The South African National Roads Agency SOC Limited (SANRAL) plans to undertake major construction and upgrades on the N3 route between the Westville viaduct and the Paradise Valley interchange. The project includes the addition of one and two lanes to create a varying four- to six-lane dual carriageway, plus auxiliary lanes where required. Further upgrades will also be made to Eden Road, the Paradise Valley interchange, including the M13 Provincial Route, and the Westville interchange, including Spine Road.

body.value:
The South African National Roads Agency SOC Limited (SANRAL) plans to undertake major construction and upgrades on the N3 route between the Westville viaduct and the Paradise Valley interchange.

The project includes the addition of one and two lanes to create a varying four- to six-lane dual carriageway, plus auxiliary lanes where required. Further upgrades will also be made to Eden Road, the Paradise Valley interchange, including the M13 Provincial Route, and the Westville interchange, including Spine Road.

The project will also involve major bridge construction works, including the widening of the Westville and Paradise Valley viaducts, which are between 25 m to 30 m in height above both valleys.

The project will also involve major bridge construction works, including the widening of the Westville and Paradise Valley viaducts, which are between 25 m to 30 m in height above both valleys.

attributes.content: The Tanzania National Roads Agency is actively advancing plans for the construction of the Godegode Bridge spanning 154 meters and its associated approach roads covering 6.0 kilometers along the Mpwapwa - Makutano Junction - Pwaga Junction - Lumuma Road. This infrastructure project is designed to alleviate traffic congestion and enhance connectivity in the specified region contributing to improved transportation and accessibility.

attributes.field_event_type: The A&A Towers Is Progressing Steadily

field_news.value:
The A&A Towers, developed by Arkland Properties and Amlad Group, is progressing steadily in Eko Atlantic. This ultra-luxury mixed-use development consists of residential, retail, and office spaces, with 98 residential units spread across floors 5 to 22, offering 1, 2, and 3-bedroom apartments along with two penthouses. The Tower, designed by renowned architect Atilla Ilhan, stands at 73 meters with stunning ocean views.

Amenities include an 800-square meter clubhouse, a gym, a cafÃ©, a spa, and a restaurant. The project is a highly anticipated addition to Lagos' luxury real estate market.

Source: Business Day

Renowned for its academic excellence and focus on research and innovation, UDSM offers a wide range of programs and operates modern facilities across its main and additional campuses. It attracts a diverse student body and is actively involved in community development and international collaborations, contributing significantly to education and research.

attributes.title: Ministry Of National Housing and Social Amenities

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Ministry Of National Housing and Social Amenities | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of National Housing and Social Amenities in Zimbabwe is responsible for developing and implementing housing policies. It plays a crucial role in providing adequate housing and social amenities to citizens. According to the Constitution (Amendment Number 20 of 2013, Section 28), the Ministry ensures access to both home ownership and rental options. Home ownership can be obtained through outright purchase or rent-to-buy schemes from government, local authorities, or the private sector, with security provided by title deeds.

body.value: The Ministry of National Housing and Social Amenities in Zimbabwe is responsible for developing and implementing housing policies. It plays a crucial role in providing adequate housing and social amenities to citizens. According to the Constitution (Amendment Number 20 of 2013, Section 28), the Ministry ensures access to both home ownership and rental options. Home ownership can be obtained through outright purchase or rent-to-buy schemes from government, local authorities, or the private sector, with security provided by title deeds. The Ministry supports Vision 2030, aiming for a prosperous, upper-middle-income society by 2030.
body.processed: The Ministry of National Housing and Social Amenities in Zimbabwe is responsible for developing and implementing housing policies. It plays a crucial role in providing adequate housing and social amenities to citizens. According to the Constitution (Amendment Number 20 of 2013, Section 28), the Ministry ensures access to both home ownership and rental options. Home ownership can be obtained through outright purchase or rent-to-buy schemes from government, local authorities, or the private sector, with security provided by title deeds. The Ministry supports Vision 2030, aiming for a prosperous, upper-middle-income society by 2030.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Nigeria has huge agricultural potential. With over 84 million hectares of arable land, of which only 40% is cultivated; a population of 167 million people, making her Africaâs largest market; 230 billion cubic meters of water; and abundant and reliable rainfall in over two-thirds of its territory, the country has some of the richest natural resources for agricultural production in the world.

body.value:
Nigeria has huge agricultural potential. With over 84 million hectares of arable land, of which only 40% is cultivated; a population of 167 million people, making her Africaâs largest market; 230 billion cubic meters of water; and abundant and reliable rainfall in over two-thirds of its territory, the country has some of the richest natural resources for agricultural production in the world. Not surprisingly, Nigeria used to be a major player in the global agricultural market in the past, as the worldâs largest producer of groundnuts and palm oil in the 1960s, and the second-largest exporter of cocoa. The country was also self-sufficient in food production before the emergence of oil in the 1960s.

The Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (FMARD), is a Ministry of the Nigerian government that regulates agricultural research, agriculture and natural resources, forestry, and veterinary research all over Nigeria.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Cape Winelands Airport, formerly Fisantekraal Airfield, is an ex-South African Air Force airfield built in 1943 and used to operate Lockheed Ventura bombers. It has been in private ownership since 1993 and serves as a general flying airfield for flight training in Cape Town. Fixed wing and helicopter schools, Air Mercy Services' Pilatus PC-12 from Cape Town International (FACT) and Morningstar airfield (Morningstar Flight Academy) also visit for circuit and emergency training. Private and company aircraft occasionally pick up or drop passengers at Cape Winelands Airport.

attributes.content: The Federal Capital Territory Administration (FCTA) is an organ of the Federal Government of Nigeria charged with the responsibility of running the affairs of the Federal Capital Territory. FCTA operates on a functional pedestal of seven (7) Secretariat which handles issues pertaining to all aspects of human Endeavour. Below these Secretariats are several Departments and Agencies. The Secretariats are Transport, Education, Social Development and Agriculture. Others are Area Councils, Health and Human Services, and Legal Services.

FCTA operates on a functional pedestal of seven (7) Secretariat which handles issues pertaining to all aspects of human Endeavour. Below these Secretariats are several Departments and Agencies. The Secretariats are Transport, Education, Social Development and Agriculture. Others are Area Councils, Health and Human Services, and Legal Services. Each Secretariat is headed by a well-qualified, experienced technocrat appointed by the government. The mandate of the Administration is to build and administer a Federal Capital Territory in compliance with the master plan through the establishment of an effective and ensuring service-oriented administration that can respond to the needs to all residents and other stakeholders.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The government of Zimbabwe is a unitary presidential republic with a multi-party system. The President acts as both head of state and government, and the legislative branch is bicameral, comprising the Senate and the House of Assembly. Since independence in 1980, Zimbabwe has encountered significant political challenges, including economic crises and human rights issues. The Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front (ZANU-PF) has been the dominant political party, raising concerns about the integrity of democratic processes.

body.value: The government of Zimbabwe is a unitary presidential republic with a multi-party system. The President acts as both head of state and government, and the legislative branch is bicameral, comprising the Senate and the House of Assembly. Since independence in 1980, Zimbabwe has encountered significant political challenges, including economic crises and human rights issues. The Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front (ZANU-PF) has been the dominant political party, raising concerns about the integrity of democratic processes. Efforts for reform and better governance are ongoing amid persistent socio-economic difficulties.

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: National Social Security Authority (NSSA) | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The National Social Security Authority (NSSA) was established under the National Social Security Act (Chapter 17:04) of 1989, enacted by Parliament. This legislation grants authority to the Minister of Public Service, Labour, and Social Welfare to create social security schemes aimed at providing benefits to all employees. NSSA is responsible for the administration of each scheme and fund established under this Act.

body.value:
The National Social Security Authority (NSSA) was established under the National Social Security Act (Chapter 17:04) of 1989, enacted by Parliament. This legislation grants authority to the Minister of Public Service, Labour, and Social Welfare to create social security schemes aimed at providing benefits to all employees. NSSA is responsible for the administration of each scheme and fund established under this Act.

Social security involves implementing public policy measures designed to safeguard individuals during life events or conditions that jeopardize their livelihood and well-being. Such situations include sickness, workplace injuries, unemployment, disability, old age, retirement, and death.
body.processed:
The National Social Security Authority (NSSA) was established under the National Social Security Act (Chapter 17:04) of 1989, enacted by Parliament. This legislation grants authority to the Minister of Public Service, Labour, and Social Welfare to create social security schemes aimed at providing benefits to all employees. NSSA is responsible for the administration of each scheme and fund established under this Act.

Social security involves implementing public policy measures designed to safeguard individuals during life events or conditions that jeopardize their livelihood and well-being. Such situations include sickness, workplace injuries, unemployment, disability, old age, retirement, and death.

body.value:
MCA is a Portuguese group founded in 1998 in GuimarÃ£es. The name of the company derives from its founder, the entrepreneur Manuel Couto Alves, who currently serves as Chairman of the Company. The initial core activity was the construction of infrastructure facilities, such as roads, bridges, water and sanitation, civil, maritime, power, and electrical facilities.

In 2006, MCA began its internationalization process, with Angola taking a predominant role. The company has since expanded its activities across Europe, Africa, and the Americas.

In 2021, with the consolidation of its strong commitment to the Energies business, MCA embarked on an ambitious path of realigning its strategy and governance model.

Today, MCA is focused on further developing the businesses of renewable energies, circular economy, urban development, and health.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: CRJE (EAST AFRICA) LIMITED, a key player in the East African construction sector, is headquartered in Dar es Salaam and operates in Tanzania, Uganda, Kenya, and Rwanda. Originally CRCEG (TANZANIA), the company rebranded in 2013 and is part of China Railway Jianchang Engineering Co., Ltd., within the China Railway Group Limited (CREC). Specializing in infrastructure projects such as roads, bridges, and railways, CRJE manages over 150 contracts worth around $576 million and signs new contracts valued at approximately 1.8 billion RMB annually.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation Ltd. (CCECC) was established in 1979 and is a large-scale state-owned enterprise engaged in international contracting and economic cooperation. Initially focused on railway construction, CCECC has expanded its business scope to include civil engineering design, consultancy, real estate development, trading, industrial investment, and hotel management. CCECC has extensive experience in executing China's largest foreign-aid project, TAZARA, and has subsequently broadened its business operations beyond the Foreign Aid Department.

body.value:
Standard Chartered, established in the UK in 1853, operates from its headquarters at 1 Basinghall Avenue in London, where both the Group CEO and Chairman are located. Regulated by the Prudential Regulation Authority and the Financial Conduct Authority, it is one of the UKâs largest banks and a FTSE100 company listed since 1969.

London serves as the hub for Standard Chartered's Europe and Americas business, facilitating operations across Asia, Africa, and the Middle East. The location supports Corporate, Commercial, and Institutional Banking, as well as a significant Private Banking presence in the region.

Since July 2010, Standard Chartered has proudly sponsored Liverpool Football Club, highlighting its commitment to community engagement and global visibility.

The bank offers a range of services, including wholesale, retail, investment, and transactional banking, catering to individuals, small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), local corporations, multinationals, governments, and financial institutions. attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Established in 1962 as Jiangsu Construction Group Co., Ltd., the company underwent several transformations over the years. Initially named Jiangsu Construction Engineering Bureau in 1978 and later Jiangsu Construction Engineering Corporation in 1983, it primarily managed administrative functions for the province's construction sector. In 1996, it transitioned into an economic entity, achieving group company status in 2001.

body.value:
Established in 1962 as Jiangsu Construction Group Co., Ltd., the company underwent several transformations over the years. Initially named Jiangsu Construction Engineering Bureau in 1978 and later Jiangsu Construction Engineering Corporation in 1983, it primarily managed administrative functions for the province's construction sector. In 1996, it transitioned into an economic entity, achieving group company status in 2001. Renamed as "Jiangsu Construction Group Co., Ltd." in 2012 during the 18th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the company has thrived in a conducive business environment, becoming the sole provincial state-owned enterprise in the construction engineering sector.

Known domestically and internationally for its superior construction expertise and top-notch services, Jiangsu Construction Group adheres to a strategy of undertaking projects, establishing a presence, and expanding market reach in its engineering endeavors. This approach has propelled the company's business scale and brand reputation to new heights, marking significant milestones in its growth and development.

attributes.content: Raubex, a prominent infrastructure development and construction materials supply group in South Africa, was established in 1974 and publicly listed on the JSE in March 2007. Operating extensively across southern Africa and Western Australia, Raubex is recognized as a Level 1 B-BBEE group, employing over 7,000 professionals.

body.value:
Raubex, a prominent infrastructure development and construction materials supply group in South Africa, was established in 1974 and publicly listed on the JSE in March 2007. Operating extensively across southern Africa and Western Australia, Raubex is recognized as a Level 1 B-BBEE group, employing over 7,000 professionals.

The company's mission is to lead the African market in road and civil engineering contracting, as well as in the provision of construction materials and mining services, while consistently meeting stakeholder expectations. Raubex comprises four key divisions: Roads and Earthworks Division, Construction Materials Division, Materials Handling and Mining Division, and Infrastructure Division. The group is committed to upholding high standards of integrity, professionalism, and quality across all its operations
